Uses of Interface
edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource

  • Packages that use PIDSource 
    Package Description
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj
    The WPI Robotics library (WPILibJ) is a set of Java classes that interfaces to the hardware in the FRC control system and your robot.
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.filters  
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.interfaces

      Use a rate gyro to return the robots heading relative to a starting position.

      class  GyroBase

    • Uses of PIDSource in edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.filters

      Classes in edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.filters that implement PIDSource 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Filter
      Superclass for filters.
      class  LinearDigitalFilter
      This class implements a linear, digital filter.
      Methods in edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.filters with parameters of type PIDSource 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static LinearDigitalFilter LinearDigitalFilter.highPass(PIDSource source, double timeConstant, double period)
      Creates a first-order high-pass filter of the form: y[n] = gain*x[n] + (-gain)*x[n-1] + gain*y[n-1] where gain = e^(-dt / T), T is the time constant in seconds.
      static LinearDigitalFilter LinearDigitalFilter.movingAverage(PIDSource source, int taps)
      Creates a K-tap FIR moving average filter of the form: y[n] = 1/k * (x[k] + x[k-1] + ...
      static LinearDigitalFilter LinearDigitalFilter.singlePoleIIR(PIDSource source, double timeConstant, double period)
      Creates a one-pole IIR low-pass filter of the form: y[n] = (1-gain)*x[n] + gain*y[n-1] where gain = e^(-dt / T), T is the time constant in seconds.
      Constructors in edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.filters with parameters of type PIDSource 
      Constructor and Description
      Filter(PIDSource source) 
      LinearDigitalFilter(PIDSource source, double[] ffGains, double[] fbGains)
      Create a linear FIR or IIR filter.
